    Guanyi Chen

    I am a PhD student in Computing Science, Utrecht University, working on Natural Language Generation. I am supervised by Prof. Kees van Deemter and Dr. Chenghua Lin.

    About Me

    Iâ€™m a PhD student in Department of Information and Computing Sciences at Utrecht University. I am supervised by Prof. Kees van Deemter and Dr. Chenghua Lin. I am also affilliated with Natural Lanaguage Processing Group in Utrecht University.

    Before came to Utrecht, I was a PhD candidate in Computing Science department at University of Aberdeen for nearly a year. Before that, I was a research internship in Natural Language Understanding group of Language Computing Lab at Samsung Research Center Beijing. Before that, I obtained my master degree in Artificial Intelligence at Unversity of Edinburgh and my specialist was Natural Language Processing. I did my under-graduate in e-Commerce Engineering with Law at Beijing University of Posts and Telecommunications and Queen Mary University of London.

    Research

    My primary research interest is in Natural Language Generation, especially for Mandarin. More specifically, my PhD topic is on more theoretical aspects of the natural language generation, i.e., Referring Expression Generation. It is about how to build computational models to mimic language use of human beings.

    Besides that, I also do some practical stuffs related to language generation, such as dialgue systems, linguistic realisation, and so forth.

    Services

    • I used to organised a mini NLP and ML reading group at the Department of Computing Science, University of Aberdeen
    • Program Committee: ACL 2019, INLG 2019
